Reviews.Title: “For real travelers. Nice Staff, good food.”
Reviews.Author: Ghistos
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to be in Playa. The restaurant served an amazingly good coffee for starting the day. The pool is located in the tropical garden and it is a real pleasure to spend the late afternoon there. The staff, from the cook to the maid, everyone is very kind and smiley. The people who come here are generally real travelers and it's give a real good mood to the hotel. Our room was very clean, room service is each day and beds are comfortable. I will return at Casa Tucan !!! It is a 2 1/2 - 3 stars hotel who deserve a 5 stars rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / good value”
Reviews.Author: ge0rge333
Reviews.Content: We are a 55-year-old couple traveling with backpacks. The hotel is modest and provided our needs, what a great location. I like to stay where young people stay, though there where many other travelers our age. The restaurant was a good place to begin the day. All staff is very helpful. The hotel has new safety deposit boxes in the room next to the office. If you can't find what you are looking for, there is a door on the left side of the swimming pool, which connects to Hotel Paraiso Azul. It is a ten-dollar upgrade and will fit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “...very loud... Very smelly”
Reviews.Author: Brittzilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during an intrepid trip throughout Guatemala, Belize, and Mexico. At first everything was fine about this hotel, but as night fell more problems arose. We got the fishermans room, and the bathroom was horrible. There was no ventilation and it smelled like an old urinal. The birds in the trees around the hotel squawk at all hours of the night. There was a dance club playing music until 5 am next door. At 6:30 am other guests would start slamming doors and yelling... The beds were very hard. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: abigailita
Reviews.Content: We had a double room without bathroom for 400 pesos -- very good price. Only problem was we were on top floor and only bathroom was on bottom floor. The room was really comfortable, though. And location was perfect. Cool and inexpensive bar/cafe on ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky little gem”
Reviews.Author: elestoban
Reviews.Content: Not far from main drag & therefore the beach & hence rather noisy. Great little cafe / restaurant doing excellent breakfasts from 46 pesos inc juice,coffee & toast - free wifi Cabanas 18 & 19 are built on a flat roof overlooking the pool area & boast outside table & hammock Room was large with double & single bed,fridge,fan & bathroom was very nice Some of our fellow travellers had their own mini kitchen - and everyone seemed to be happy with their rooms - cheap,cheerful & clean and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Tucan Hotel in Playa del Carmen. Chichen Itza & Cancun”
Reviews.Author: 82nancy54
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took our annual mother/daughter trip and we picked Casa Tucan Hotel in Playa del Carmen. This hotel is very middle of the road so to speak and we had a wonderful time and had a very nice room for a cheap price. The hotel is 2 blocks or so from the beach, so you save $$ by not being right on the beach. This hotel has a nice swimming pool and beautiful gardens and has a pretty good restaurant for a great breakfast before hitting the beach. We found that you have to rent beach chairs for the beach, so we just parked ourselves at one of the beach side restaurants and ordered food and drinks once in awhile and had a great time. We took the ferry over to Cozumel and spent the day snorkeling. Rented a jeep and toured the island and then headed back to Playa del Carmen and found a beach restaurant to have a great dinner. Took the bus to Cancan and spent a few days before heading to the airport and home. The hotel was the Aquamarine and was very nice for the money. But if you don't purchase an all inclusive plan then you can not eat at the hotel. So we took the bus, which you catch right down the street and went into town. Had great food and had a wonderful mother/daughter trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Mora Z
Reviews.Content: I spent in this hotel two wonderful nights the last week of november. And the first thing that catched my atention was the jungle-like enviroment... walking to the room they gave me made me think in one of the places I love the most near to the jungle in Chiapas... I loved it so much. And then... coming into the room... I found it so delightful. Simple but beautiful with all the walls painted with a fresh natural scene. Everything was so clean, the room was fresh and calm, next to the pool. And the only thing I could hear was a peacock wich is not in the hotel, but in one of the places around. It was marvelous! Then I wanted to see more of the rooms (of course, after my nice sleeping there) and I was amazed by the original paints, different from each other, in every room. A place to be in love with nature and with the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small and simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonas B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a pool to get trained in diving... this is you best option there have a pool 4.1 mts deep and a dive center Called yucatek Divers at the back part. Melva (reseption) Friendly and a nice attention. The restaurant has Really good food and for a fair price... Great garden in the back part, with alot of green arround. I will defendly go back. Just one thing.... no t in this season there is a lot of mosquitos but i understand its hard to get them exterminated :) :)

Reviews.Title: “you can at the tucan”
Reviews.Author: neetrip
Reviews.Content: Excellent holiday.Good food, very clean, great location. Fantastic theme restaurants especially the steak house. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. First time at this hotel, but have been to Mexico three times previously. First time we have not had a dodgy tummy. I spoke to lots of people on this holiday from many different countries and everyone was very impressed and I never heard one complaint or whinge. I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, central”
Reviews.Author: Jackrabbit11
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown Playa del Carmen, this small hotel is built around a shaded, central courtyard/garden which means that the rooms are quiet. There is no formal lobby but there are benches in the garden. There are only 30 rooms--some have hotplates--but the onsite restaurant is very good, serving traditional Mexican fare. There is a pool with some deck chairs; it's small, but it's clean and well-maintained. The best thing about this hotel is its central location, close to all the hot nightspots in Playa, close to the ferry to Cozumel, close to the central bus station, close to shopping and dive shop operators; and the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: jellyfish08
Reviews.Content: One of the best cozy hotels in downtown playa del carmen... their staff is awsome, awsome food in the restaurant, cheap beer... i love it!! and the staff from the front desk they are great people. Nicole and Oscar help us many times, they are excellent people. and about the rooms they are perfect to chiil out with friends.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs and terrible noise - do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: backpackinginheels
Reviews.Content: i came here led on by reviews in various guidebooks and with high expectations that were all completely shot down. this was my first night of vacation and i woke up having more than 300 bites from bed bugs!! the noise from surrounding clubs was so loud that i got a maximum of 3 hours sleep despite earplugs. service at the reception is entirely indifferent and apparently incapable of smiling or providing any kind of information. upon my request for a safe, someone carried a wooden box into my room, which naturally anyone could have just taken out. bearing in mind that this is supposed to be a midrange hotel, there was not a sinhle thing i can recommend in casa tucan. the pool seemed dingy and dirty and the restaurant was empty (one make of that what they will). when i emailed the hotel about my experience they denied everything, naturally. this has been my single worst hotel stay in the 15 years i've traveled the world. genuinely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home.... mmm the coffee is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: walkfootman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely for the budget traveler who appreciates the basics in a beautiful little cozy setting,.. and doesn't need ridiculous luxury and waste. I discovered this gem of a hotel thinking I'd try it for a night and I ended up staying a full week in an older palyapa room for 300 pesos a night (around 28 dollars) I was cool enough with just a ceiling fan. They have rooms with ac and cable TV for more, but who needs it? It's German owned and many of the guests are German, but I also met some Canadians, Italians,& Argentinians as well as a few of us from the States. M y room was always cleaned perfectly. I'd say the quality of the bed was just ok. Ton's of hot water in the shower,..yumm.. When I wasn't at the beach it's wonderful to hang out at the newly renovated pool in the spectacular tropical garden setting and the amazing "fusion" restaurant out front. They have a lending library for those of you who forget your vacation book. The free wifi in the pool area and restauraant is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location-quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmeredith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights around New Years with my family. I was a little nervous after reading all of the reviews but found it to be perfectly suited to us for our few days in playa del carmen. The location was perfect-minutes to walk to the beach, close to shopping and the clubs but tucked away so that the only noise was the sound of the birds! The service was friendly and my internet booking went smooth and was problem free. The rooms were clean but sparse. A couple of extra blankets would have been nice-we asked but they seemed to be in short supply. The restaurant located on the ground floor served delicious food for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value and location”
Reviews.Author: Smudge15
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay that is clean, friendly, and of wonderful value you should try the Casa Tucan. The atmosphere here is unbeatable, especially with the hotel being built around a large tree so you can hear the birds in the evening. Casa Tucan has a small pool and many cozy areas to sit and have a beer or chat with friends/family. Particularly nice are the top two rooms that offer you a private area with a table and chairs. The rooms are brightly colored, simple, and comfortable. We have been to many hotels in Playa and around Mexico and this is undoubtedly our favorite. The location only blocks from 5th and the beach is unbeatable, and there is also a good restaurant down below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for nature lovers”
Reviews.Author: verdulo1
Reviews.Content: I live where it is very cold in the winter so I am delighted to see greenery. This hotel has lots of it. And birds. It was delightful! And for such a good price! The one drawback was that at the time of our stay the nights were chilly. The thatch roof of our room did not hold in heat and I had a bad cold which was not helped by the cold room. Another concern we had was the bugs. Or rather, the lack of them. What were they spraying to kill them and how harmful is it to us? If I were to return I would inquire about this. The location was ideal. Close to everything (including the beach) but not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “ok place”
Reviews.Author: Toesinthesand1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, however, the rooms are very dark and there is no AC. The employees at the front desk were not helpful at all; they always looked like you were bothering them when you asked them something, The location is good, not far from 5th avenue and the beach. They do not post hours for their internet centre, so if you need it be sure to use it before 8:30 PM (I need to check in and they told me it was closed -- this was around 9 PM) I would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1013
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for two nights beginning the 24th of May. I have stayed here a few times befroe, each time with different people, in different rooms. I am never let down by the courtesy of the staff, and their great sense of humor. Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted- Nicole already had our key in hand! She led us to our room, which was on the second floor. It was very basic, as are all of the rooms here. It had two double beds, a tv, and mini fridge. We were not in Playa to spend a ton of time in the room- it was perfect for us! We enjoyed breakfast the next morning in the restaurant at the entrance to the hotel. The art on the walls was gorgeous- come to find the owner loved one of the paintings so much he purchased it! :-) Our breakfast was amazing. We enjoyed fresh baked bread with homemade marmalade- 2 kinds! The coffee was to DIE for. It was literally so good you never put the cup down. Each cup is fresh ground and brewed; the owner has an agreement with a woman who travels to northern Mexico to grab the beans, then roasts them right in Playa... The owner said sometimes the bags are still warm when she delivers them. 'nuff said. All in all, this property is great for the budget traveler and people who enjoy authentic lodging in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Drunk”
Reviews.Author: ahootenanny
Reviews.Content: if you slip the bellboy 100 he will upgrade you to the condos on the beach well worth the money . the food on the other hand was below average but the cost refle=cts the quality we were there to get drunk on the beach Mission Accomplished

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but very cool nontheless”
Reviews.Author: ScubaBen_54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cool, not at all what I expected to find in the middle of city like Playa. As soon as you go in you are surrounded by greenery, and it really doesn´t feel like you are in a town anymore, all the street noise just fades into the background and I instantly relaxed. The room I stayed in was painted tro resemble a giant garden, everything was really clean and the bathroom was tucked away up a a couple of stairs and around a corner (in the room). The price was very competitive and although I didn´t eat there other guests told me the food was pretty good. There is a pool, again tucked away in the middle of the trees and it´s pretty deep too, about 5metres I think.... I would definately recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a budget getaway, definately worth the (very competitive) price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place too relax :)”
Reviews.Author: FrankNortoft
Reviews.Content: I stay at Casa Tucan fore the hole october month, The Hotel and the restaurant where great. The Manager Horst, and the staff where very helpfull. the food at the restaurant Tucan sabor was cheep and very good - Not to mention the caffee, I got it fress every morning. I give my best recommend too the Hotel. thx. 4 the stay ;) Frank

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: simbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Tucan in July 2009. We had room #8 and were really happy with the room. First our daughter said that the room is pretty small, however we have traveled a lot and compared what you usually get for a smaller budget is not as nice as what you get in Casa Tucan. The room was clean, the water pressure was strong (have seen the other reviews!) and at that time the water quality in the pool was very good. We spent quite a bit time at the pool also during the evening with a bottle of wine and it was our tropical retreat from the louder parts of the town. Safes are free of charge as was the storage of our luggage before departure. The receptionist was always friendly and helpful! The locations is perfect and we enjoyed also good breakfast in the restaurant just in front of the hotel. We recommend Casa Tucan to everyone with a smaller budget but don´t be to picky, you are not in a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fyrfly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 days in Playa del Carmen at the Casa Tucan. We had a room #9 on the 3rd floor with kitchenette. This included an electric burner, small frig, sink, plates, utensils, coffee pot, pots and pans. The room was clean and could sleep 4, although that might be a bit cozy. The water pressure in the shower was not always strong but that may have been that way since we were on the 3rd floor. It didn't bother us much. If you happened to take a shower in the middle of the day, they might not have had a chance to wash your towells that had been removed when they cleaned the room. Luckily we had brought our own for when we went diving. I thought that the price was good for the spacious room that we got although I felt the room was a bit on the dark side. I was disappointed that this room did not have an outdoor seating area as most rooms seems to have. There was a place to hang a hammock inside which my husband actually used. If I were going with a group again, I would try to get rooms #9 and #10(1 double + 1 single). Room #10 has a real nice seating area, picture included. A few nights we heard noise from a bar down the street that woke us up, not good if you are a light sleeper. The bar scene seems to run from 12-6. My sister and her husband stayed in room #5. She thought the room was a bit on the small side and a little dark. The bathroom in this room was smelly. There must have been a problem with the the toilet seal. I wish that she would have said something because I think that she could have switched rooms (I didn't find out until the her last day there). Otherwise, I liked her room. She had a nice seating area (picture included) that had a table and hammock outside her door where we would all gather. Her kids stayed in room #1 across the mini-courtyard from 5. This was a spaceous room with a frig that did not work. Again, they should have told the management about this problem. This room had 2 double beds and a table inside. No real sitting area outside. Hammock rings inside. Management was very nice. The hotel is only 2.5 blocks from the beach. There is plenty of nightlife and lots of restaurants to choose from although La Quinta has alot of expensive places. Walmart is about an 8 block walk away for stocking up on water and snacks. I'm not one to hang out at the pool but it looked like a pleasant enough area. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this as a good priced budget hotel. Parking: we paid $5 per day to park across the street behind a gate. That was very convenient as you might have to park a few blocks away otherwise, the area is pretty busy at night. The hotel restaurant was good, my sister ate there several times and she is picky. There was a room set up for Internet that had about 6 computer, not high speed but adequate for checking email and such.

Reviews.Title: “cute, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimberlandia
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Casa Tucan. It had super cute grounds and a very comfortable and clean room. There were a lot of amenities at the hotel, including a restaurant, internet, and a pool. They don't have parking in the building itself, but they set us up with parking across the street for an affordable price. The location is also good-- it's a two minute walk from Avenida Quinta. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “funky and fun”
Reviews.Author: MaineCaribbeansoul
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Playa del Carmen over the holidays with our two children. We selected Casa Tucan on the advice of a friend. It worked out just right for us. It is a simple place with lots of character for a great price. We loved the location close to the tourist area, beach and the real local community. It is an easy walk to everything from Casa. We had a large room for $70US a night with a table and 2 chairs, a bathroom with a large shower, a double bed and 2 twins also use of small kitchen area. ( no TV or A/C) Our room opened out on the garden and pool and we had ceiling fans to cool us. It is a little oasis with all of the lush greenery. The hotel was quiet too despite the many parties in the streets around the holidays. Each morning I could sit and read by the pool as my girls slept in. We swam every day in the pool and ate many good meals in the restaurant at the hotel. We enjoyed the coffee especially! The pool was cleaned every morning. It was clear and refreshing. Everyone was friendly and kind. Some may feel the hotel is run down but we could overlook that as we feel it was a good value and good place for us to use as a base for our adventures. If you prefer luxury you might be disappointed here. This is a very basic, clean and friendly hotel. Each room is very different and unique. We met many interesting European families here too.

Reviews.Title: “Passable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEXICANEXPRESSGIRL
Reviews.Content: We wanted a budget place for a few days and in Playa there are only a limited number of such places. We decided on the Casa Tucan following a recommendation from 2 fellow Americans we met in Mexico City. The biggest problem we had was the heat in the rooms. I could just about cope but my friend found it really bad. Also, there was a stale smell in the room which we didn't like. It was also very dark in there, and the light was not good enough in the evening. The attached restaurant was good and served good portions. We used it quite a few times. I would recommend it even if you aren't staying in the hotel, for at least one or two meals. The 5th Avenue can be kinda expensive to eat at all the time. The pool was ok and the maids seemed to work hard.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the money”
Reviews.Author: TROPICSANDSUNLIGHT
Reviews.Content: I first came here a few years ago when it was owned by an American called Gary Wendt. Gary had a vision and an energy about him that added to the experience. Sadly Gary sold it and the new owner is rather different. But the Casa Tucan still has something to offer the budget traveller. Stay in one of the more expensive rooms, as the cheaper ones without air-con tend to be very hot. It is worth spending a little more to be able to sleep properly! I didn't experience any of the bed-bug problems that earlier reviewers have mentioned, and very little cockroach problems, which can be a problem in any hot country. If you spray your room before going out of an evening you can probably alleviate the age old mosquito problem that plagues the tropics. When you return home late evening close the door quickly behind you, minimising the chances of mossies getting in! The restaurant was great and the portions are generous. I recommend the excellent nachos, and definitely have your breakfasts here as they are good! It is very good value and way cheaper than the 5th Avenida places. Anja's lovely smile stays in my memory. The receptionist was very helpful in sorting out my trips to the Mayan ruins and I enjoyed my time. The pool is fairly good but the surface can look dirty with the insects. Overall a good spot and pretty good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIETRAVELMAN
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Perth, Western Australia, after a long tiring flight and wanted to shower and take things easy. The bathroom smelt like a gents toilet, which didn't please us, with a skid mark in the toilet bowl. The shower was so feeble it was laughable. It was almost impossible to shower with the weak spray. I tried to plug my iPod speakers into the wall socket but it didn't work. I tried the other socket and the sound kept crackling as the current or something is not working properly. The beds are old and lumpy , and we kept itching during the night. Mosquitoes were present in the room but my mains run mosquitoe repellent didn't work properly because of the electric problem with the sockets. The next day we ate in the restaurant at the front of the complex. When I was waiting to pay I saw cockroaches running around the bar area and behind the counter. The Mexican chef was visibly perspiring into the food as he made it. We didn't eat there again. The website mentions a pool bar but it was not working. You could tell by the place that it hadn't been working for a long time. The pool is not clean, and the sunbeds are mostly damaged and dirty. We moved room after 3 nights but found the same electric problems, and the bathroom only smelt slightly better. Even the bedroom had the same stale smell that we kept masking with deodorant and perfume. I wanted to speak to the owner about the room but he was never around. The Mexican man in reception said he is always out drinking and spends little time working there. This place has nothing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and low standards”
Reviews.Author: transientone
Reviews.Content: I arrived here with my wife with high expectations having been convinced by a good friend who stayed here previously. We were so disappointed. The place is not looked after very well and our room was shoddy. The sheets are very cheap and the shower was weak. The attached scuba school would start up around 7.45 every morning and wake us, thanks to the noise they make. But worse was to come. The bed bugs were very bad indeed, causing both of us discomfort. We got our rooms changed but the same thing happened again. Mosquitoes also like the rooms, maybe because of the neglected garden area. It was like a wild garden. There was also noise from construction. The pool seemed dirty so we didnt use it. The grime around the póol was quite bad, and you didin{t want to sit around the area for long. Cockroaches kept showing up in our bathroom and we kept showering them down the plug hole. It was an ongojing problem. Even the safe deposit room stunk of a stale odour and the nearby toilet for people using the small restaurant stank of urine. Every night a group of drunk old Germans who live there would turn up and sit near the entrance area, loud and obnoxious. They got on peoples nerves. The restaurant is nothing spécial with a limited menu. The two Europeans running it seemed fed up, adding to the lousy atmosphere. The small internet cafe is the worst laid out, claustrophobic one I have ever encountered. For tiny people only! It is like an oven. And it isnt cheap. We left after 4 nights and stayed at the superb Hotel Fusion, on the beach at Calle 6. It was more expensive but well worth the money with a great bar and restaurant. We needed to cheer ourselves up after this below par dump.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: BACKPACKER81
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Casa Tucan with my girlfriend to celebrate our engagement. I had previously stayed there in 2007 and thought it was pretty good value. But as soon as we arrived I knew things had changed for the worse. The first thing I noticed was how dirty and overgrown the garden and pool area had become. You have to bend down to avoid the branches and leaves, and the paths seriously need a proper scrub and the litter cleared. When we got to our room we immediately found 2 dead cockroaches and later 2 live ones which we managed to get out. Given the filth in the complex this is hardly surprising. The sheets had stains of the worst kind and the room smelled very stale and needed attention in a number of areas. It all pointed to neglect. However, there was tremendous noise from drilling and hammering that began every morning as the owner is spending money on new rooms being constructed which ruins the already crowded complex. He should be addressing the decline of the old rooms instead of building new ones. The man reeks of stale alcohol and makes little sense when you speak to him. He seems more interested in doing repetitive arm exercizes in the filthy pool than helping run the hotel, which got on our nerves very quickly. The pool is now absolutely filthy, full of insects, dirt and leaves brought in by the adjacent scuba school which uses the pool for teaching. Nobody bothers to scoop it all out. Cigarette butts and a variety of insects and old leaves await the brave swimmer. I noticed only the owner used it!!! Even the sunbeds are damaged and dirty. Everything needs replacing or urgent attention. The once pleasant adjacent restaurant run by a young German couple is not what it was. The old menus are grubby and the service is surly. I speak fluent German having lived there for 9 months and would sit and listen to the 2 owners bad mouthing their clients and making spiteful remarks behind their backs. They seem to hate every nationality. The food there is very mediocre nowadays. We checked out after 2 nights and spent the next 12 nights in La Rana Cansada on Calle 10 which was excellent. It also has the super Bar Ranita attached, which is friendly and great fun, run by Mexican girls. Talk about the opposite of the Casa Tucan.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Taylor_Flashpackers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following it's rave reviews on trip advisor and in the Lonely Planet. We were very disappointed and felt this hotel was very overrated. The room we had was spacious but it was incredibly hot, the fans did nothing to alleviate this. The sheets felt like you were sleeping in plastic, they certainly were not cotton and did not breathe so we opted to sleep in our silk sheets. We paid $45 per night and felt we would have got better value else where. On a positive note the restaurant is good, the pool is a nice reprieve and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Price-worthy and charming little place”
Reviews.Author: GrunfSweden
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at Casa Tucan looking for a cheap, clean and quiet place close to the beaches. The hotel was exactly what we expected and payed for. The place is located near to the beach and the main street but far enough from the turism buzzle. It feels even more private since it is tucked away in a lushy green garden which also offers a small pool. We never used it but it seemed popular enough. Rooms are simple and clean, with a working fan and fridge. The service was ok, when our fan stopped working they came to take a look at it the same day. The little restaurant with the same name offers nice breakfast that can be recommended for one morning. Overall, a good bargain, especially for the very touristy Playa del Carmen with relatively high prices in general.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto !”
Reviews.Author: NododyX
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend for four nights in october. The staff (german,dutch,mexican) is really nice and the food they served us in there restaurant was delicious !!! You should definetely take your breakfast there and I'm sure that you can't get a better dinner in any other tourist-restaurant of Playa del Carmen for these good prices. We have chosen a simple but nicely painted double-room without A/C (you don't need it in oct.). Most important: we had no mosquitos in our room. The pool is really deep and the scenery inside reminds you of being right in the jungle. I would come back surely !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: liselondon
Reviews.Content: Great staff, relaxed atmosphere, confortable & clean rooms at a very reasonable price. Great deep ! swimming pool, bar/restaurant area. With a mexican feel to the place. Location : 2 blocks / 5 minutes from the beach walking, so just away enough from the noisy quinta avenida, but really close enough to the beach. We lived there for 3 weeks and absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel, with charm”
Reviews.Author: baillis
Reviews.Content: I had an exellent stay there. Nice clean rooms. Short way to the beach. Very friendly staff. I felt very welcome there. I will surely come back to stay there. I recommend other to try this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Casa Tucan
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 4 entre Avenida 10y 15, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
